title: Jacksonville police: man dies after being shot, driven to hospital
content:
Jacksonville police said a young man – possibly a teenager – died after being shot at an unknown location Saturday then driven to UF Health Jacksonville.
The victim was inside a dark-colored sedan containing several people that arrived about 5:30 p.m. at the entrance to the medical center’s Emergency Room. He died a short time later, said Sgt. Robert John of the Jacksonville Sheriff’s Office Homicide Unit.
John said detectives didn’t know immediately who the victim was, where the shooting occurred or the circumstances. It was unclear how many times he had been shot. Detectives were interviewing the people who had been in the car with him, he said.
He also said it appeared nobody else inside the car had been injured.
Anyone with information about the killing can contact the Sheriff’s Office at (904) 630-0500 or JSOCrimeTips@jaxsheriff.org, or call Crime Stoppers at (866) 845-TIPS.
Teresa Stepzinski: (904) 359-4075
